smart_goals.description: Reduce daily carbohydrate intake to 45% of total caloric intake by the end of next month. Monitor and record daily carbohydrate intake using a food journal.
Engage in at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity, such as brisk walking or cycling, five days a week. Track progress using a fitness app or activity tracker.
Take prescribed metformin medication consistently, at the same time each day, to manage blood sugar levels. Record medication intake in a pill box or medication journal.
Check and record blood glucose levels before each meal and before bedtime every day. Share results with healthcare provider during monthly appointments.
Aim for a target blood glucose level of 80-130 mg/dL before meals and under 180 mg/dL two hours after meals. Monitor progress and adjust diet and medication as needed.
Maintain a water intake of at least 8 cups (64 oz) per day. Monitor progress using a water intake tracker and adjust as needed.
Reduce daily carb intake to 45g during lunch and dinner, starting from next Monday and lasting for 4 weeks.
Increase daily water intake to 2 liters, starting today and aiming to maintain this level for the next month.
Engage in at least 30 minutes of physical activity, such as brisk walking, 5 days a week, starting tomorrow and continuing until the end of the month.
Monitor and record daily blood sugar levels before each meal and at bedtime, aiming to maintain an average of 130mg/dL, starting next week and continuing for 2 months.
Achieve 7 hours of sleep per night, starting tonight and aiming to maintain this level for the next 30 days.
Reduce daily carbohydrate intake to 45% of total caloric intake by the end of next week.
Increase daily water intake to 2 liters by the end of this month.
Perform 30 minutes of moderate-intensity physical activity, 5 days a week, starting from next Monday.
Monitor and maintain HbA1c levels below 7% within the next 3 months.
Reduce daily carbohydrate intake to 45g per meal for the next 2 weeks, as documented in the food log.
Take prescribed Metformin medication twice a day, before breakfast and dinner, for the next month.
Perform a minimum of 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity aerobic activity per week, as recorded in the activity log.
Monitor and log daily blood glucose levels before meals and after dinner, aiming to keep levels below 180mg/dL, for the following month.

Reduce daily carbohydrate intake to 45% of total calories by consuming balanced meals, tracking intake using MyFitnessPal app and aiming for a target of 150g carbs per day. Achieve this goal by the end of the next month.

Perform at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity or 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity aerobic activity or an equivalent combination every week. Record progress using a fitness tracker and aim to complete this goal every week for the next month.

Monitor and maintain a stable blood glucose level of 80-130 mg/dL before meals and below 180 mg/dL after meals through proper meal planning, medication adherence, and regular testing. Achieve this goal for the following four weeks.
Maintain water intake of at least 8 glasses (64 oz) daily to improve insulin sensitivity, reduce the risk of complications, and support overall health. Achieve this goal each day for the next month.
